review: The device is easy to setup.  The FireStick is a small device and therefore it is not intrusive to your TV setup.  The USB port option eliminates the need for a 120 volt outlet to power the device.  So as long as you have a USB port on your TV set, this is a convenient feature.The FireStick keeps rebooting and to date, I have not been able to find a solution online for this problem.  So I may be sending it back to Amazon.  I am clearing not the only individual experiencing the problem.  The primary reason I brought the device was to run the Plex application so I could connect to my Plex Server.  You can load the free Plex app, but you can't watch any content until you pay $4.99.  The problem is, the process for making a payment is convoluted and I've yet to figure it out.  I'm trying to give you my money, you can't make this hard.  So I've tried once and I've yet to try again.  No VUDU application for the Firestick.  I can only assume this is because VUDU and Amazon compete.  Part of my movie library is with VUDU/Ultra Violet, not by choice, that's the only option I had.  Preventing me from viewing that content isn't going to make me switch, it will simply force me to the first product that supports multiple vendors and multiple solutions.  Which looks like RoKu.The potential is there, but a key capabilities are missing and there are some product stability issues.
author: joseph

review: Amazing product.  If you're deciding between this and a chromcast, look no more.  I have both.  This is way better than chromecast in every single metric possible.  It costs the same as a chromecast.  I can use this easily in hotel rooms (unlike the chromecast, where you're resorting to MAC spoofing to even use it).Since I have prime, I can access all my documents and pictures anywhere I carry this as long as there's a TV and wifi.  It's great.
